claim_text: The corpus contains 20 books with a deterministic novel-level split.
The student model is trained with fixed optimization settings and L2 regularization.
CIW-5 is selected by trend-fidelity-first criterion on the test split.
CIW-5 has the strongest MA(5) trend-level error profile on test data.
CIW-5 reduces error when evaluated on smoothed trajectories.
Feature clustering uses a data-driven selection and DTW is retained as validation.
Feature and DTW clustering agreement is limited and should be interpreted cautiously.
Teacher-side variant protocols exhibit measurable disagreement.
Per-book CIW-5 behavior is explicitly documented for all novels.
Final report figures and tables are reproducibly generated by stage-10 notebook.
